decks.notes: This deck revolves around quickly enchanting creatures with powerful auras to create a fast and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing cards like Alseid of Life's Bounty and Ethereal Armor, the deck aims to buff up creatures quickly and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional card advantage and recursion of key creatures or auras. With a focus on low mana cost spells and efficient creatures, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy small artifact creatures and pump them up with enchantments like Ensoul Artifact and Skilled Animator to turn them into powerful threats. The deck aims to deal quick and direct damage to the opponent using cards like Shrapnel Blast and Lightning Strike while also providing versatility with cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Hope of Ghirapur. The mana base of the deck is designed to support the aggressive strategy with color fixing and utility lands.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creatures, using cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill the deck and trigger powerful effects like Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam. It utilizes Eldritch Evolution to search for key combo pieces like Worldspine Wurm and Silversmote Ghoul while generating mana with Paradise Druid and Sylvan Caryatid. With no reliance on lands, the deck aims to win through a quick and explosive combo involving graveyard recursion and massive creature summons.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly mill cards from the opponent's library by utilizing cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer, while also utilizing self-mill effects like Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam. By constantly putting cards into the graveyard, the deck aims to generate value from graveyard recursion with cards like Haunted Dead and Silversmote Ghoul. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Jwari Disruption to disrupt the opponent's game plan, allowing the combo pieces to come together for a quick and explosive win.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, while utilizing sacrifice synergies with cards like Woe Strider, Priest of Forgotten Gods, and Zulaport Cutthroat. Mayhem Devil helps to take advantage of sacrificing creatures, while Collected Company and Bolas's Citadel provide card advantage and additional threats. Agadeem's Awakening can bring back key creatures from the graveyard. The combination of aggression, sacrifice, and card advantage makes this deck a formidable force in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck heavily focuses on control and disruption, utilizing cards like Narset, Teferi, counterspells, and hand disruption to control the game. It also includes cards for card advantage and selection like Dig Through Time and Search for Azcanta. The deck aims to control the board through removal spells like Fatal Push and Supreme Verdict, while also having the ability to disrupt the opponent's game plan with Agonizing Remorse and Thoughtseize. The mana base is also carefully constructed to support the deck's colors and spells efficiently.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, hand disruption, and board wipes, while utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for additional value. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by minimizing their resources and eventually overwhelming them with card advantage and powerful threats like Ashiok, Nightmare Muse and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. With a strong mix of removal, card draw, and resilient threats, the deck is built to outlast the opponent and secure victory through attrition.

The main concept of this deck is to flood the board with low-cost, aggressive white creatures and pump them up with anthem effects to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The deck includes cards that provide protection and removal options to maintain board presence and push for damage efficiently. With a focus on early aggression and synergy between the creatures, this deck aims to outpace the opponent and secure victory through relentless pressure and combat advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to be incredibly fast and aggressive, consistently putting pressure on the opponent from the very beginning of the game. By utilizing low-cost, efficient creatures and burn spells, along with the ability to cast spells for reduced mana costs, this deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Lurrus of the Dream-Den acts as a companion, providing additional value and recursion options for this aggressive strategy.

The deck aims to control the game and disrupt opponent's strategies through the use of powerful spells on their turn, while utilizing Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells for free each turn. With the vast array of powerful creatures and spells, the deck can quickly take control of the game and overwhelm the opponent. Yorion, Sky Nomad acts as a companion to provide additional value and card advantage. The deck focuses on maintaining board presence and card advantage to outvalue the opponent and secure victory.

The deck utilizes the synergy between Lotus Field and various cards such as Arboreal Grazer, Vizier of Tumbling Sands, and Hidden Strings to generate mana efficiently and quickly set up a powerful win condition. By ramping up mana production and digging through the deck with spells like Pore Over the Pages and Dig Through Time, the deck aims to assemble a combo finish with cards like Peer into the Abyss. The deck also includes utility lands like Blast Zone and Thespian's Stage to deal with threats and further enhance its combo potential.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, board wipes, and card draw to keep the opponent's threats in check. By leveraging powerful planeswalkers and versatile spells, the goal is to outvalue the opponent and outlast them in a battle of attrition. Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by blinking permanents and generating card advantage. The deck aims to stabilize the board, generate card advantage, and eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and card advantage.

The core idea of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to put constant pressure on the opponent by quickly deploying low-cost, aggressive creatures like Bloodsoaked Champion, Dread Wanderer, and Knight of the Ebon Legion. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Fatal Push to control the board. It aims to end the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with a strong board presence and efficient removal spells, utilizing cards like Murderous Rider, Rankle, Master of Pranks, and Spawn of Mayhem to close out the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game using a diverse range of powerful multicolored spells, aiming to use Niv-Mizzet Reborn as a card advantage engine. With a mix of removal, planeswalkers, and powerful creatures, the deck can adapt to different situations and outvalue opponents. The variety of lands also allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors, ensuring that the deck can consistently hit its curve and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilising Niv-Mizzet Reborn's ability to draw cards and gain card advantage by running a wide variety of different colored cards in the deck. The deck aims to control the game by disrupting the opponent's plans with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nahiri, the Harbinger, while also having powerful threats in the form of Omnath, Locus of Creation and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck also includes versatile removal spells and access to different colors of mana through a diverse mana base.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures like Dreadhorde Arcanist, Young Pyromancer, and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. It also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to outpace opponents and maintain card advantage through cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Village Rites, while also using Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to provide additional value by recurring key creatures and spells from the graveyard.
